sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

sentences.english: powerful institutions such as world banks
sentences.chinese: 诸如世界银行之类的强大机构

sentences.english: the Institution of Electrical Engineers
sentences.chinese: 电机工程师学会

detailed_translations.english: a large organization that has a particular kind of work or purpose

sentences.english: She loves him unconditionally.
sentences.chinese: 她无条件地爱他。

sentences.english: No, he worships you, unconditionally.
sentences.chinese: 不对，他崇拜你，无条件地。

sentences.english: But of course, we also want to be loved - we want to be rewarded unconditionally without any contingencies whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 但当然，我们都想被喜爱,-我们都想无条件的得到报酬,没有任何别的可能。

sentences.english: The software tentatively assigns each click a letter based on its frequency , then tests the message created by this assignment using statistical models of the English language .
sentences.chinese: 这一软件尝试性地按频率指派给每一个点击一个字母，然后用英语的统计模式测试这一指派所产生的信息。

sentences.english: They try to equip their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽量给他们的车辆配备各种小装置以应付任何可能的突发状况。

detailed_translations.english: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

sentences.english: We are pleased to receive your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴收到您的询问函。

sentences.english: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
sentences.chinese: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sentences.english: When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

sentences.english: See Appendix 2.6.
sentences.chinese: 见附录2.6。

sentences.english: Christine had to go into hospital to have her appendix out (=  have it removed  ) .
sentences.chinese: 克里丝蒂娜不得不去医院切除阑尾。

detailed_translations.english: a part at the end of a book containing additional information

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

sentences.english: Iron-ox is another name for tractor.
sentences.chinese: 铁牛是拖拉机的别名。

sentences.english: The tractor hauled the fertilizer away.
sentences.chinese: 拖拉机把肥料拉走了。

sentences.english: In addition to the tractor, we have acquired a new rice transplanter.
sentences.chinese: 除了拖拉机， 我们又添了一台插秧机。

detailed_translations.english: a strong vehicle with large wheels, used for pulling farm machinery

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

sentences.english: ...a garden spade.
sentences.chinese: …一把花园里使用的锹。

detailed_translations.english: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

sentences.english: To make an aluminum can, that takes energy.
sentences.chinese: 为了制造一个铝罐，就得消耗能源。

sentences.english: And she sat and sat on that aluminum throne ever since.
sentences.chinese: 自那以后，她就一直坐在那个铝制的宝座上。

sentences.english: He says not only does arsenic belong under phosphorus, I predict that there is an element that lies below aluminum and above indium.
sentences.chinese: 他认为不仅砷属于在磷下面，我预言还有一个元素,是在铝之上和铟的下边的。

sentences.english: an old tin bath
sentences.chinese: 旧的锡浴缸

detailed_translations.english: a soft silver-white metal that is often used to cover and protect iron and steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Sn
made of  tin

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认
detailed_translations.english: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

sentences.english: Others here are more sceptical about the chances for justice being done.
sentences.chinese: 这里的其他人更为怀疑正义能否得到伸张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it

sentences.english: She laid her hands on her swollen belly.
sentences.chinese: 她把手放在隆起的肚子上。

detailed_translations.english: the middle part of an animal’s body, near its stomach
to fill with air and become rounder in shape

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc
